intro: Hibbertia turleyana, commonly known as the Turley’s hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as South Australia and Western Australia. Hibbertia turleyana has lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule, containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
